info.title: PA Engine API
info.description: Allow clients to fetch PA Engine Analytics through APIs.

get.summary: Get accounts and sub-directories in a directory
get.description: This endpoint looks up all ACCT and ACTM files and sub-directories in a given directory.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The directory to get the accounts and sub-directories in

schema.description: The directory to get the accounts and sub-directories in

200.description: Expected response, returns a list of accounts and directories

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new calculation and runs the set of calculation units specified in the POST body.
This must be used first before get status or cancelling endpoints with a calculation id. 
A successful response will contain the URL to check the status of the calculation request.

Remarks:
*	Maximum 500 units allowed across all simultaneous calculations. (Refer API documentation for more information)
            
*	Any settings in POST body will act as a one-time override over the settings saved in the PA/SPAR/Vault template.

202.description: Expected response, contains the URL in the Location header to check the status of the calculation.

Location.description: URL to check status of the request.

schema.description: URL to check status of the request.

get.description:
This is the endpoint to check on the progress of a previous calculation request.
Response body contains status information of the entire request and each individual calculation unit.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: From url, provided from the location header in the Run Multiple Calculations endpoint.

schema.description: From url, provided from the location header in the Run Multiple Calculations endpoint.

200.description: Expected response, returns status information of the entire calculation and each individual calculation unit.

delete.description:
This is the endpoint to cancel a previously submitted calculation request.
Instead of doing a GET on the getCalculationById URL, cancel the calculation by doing a DELETE.
All individual calculation units within the calculation will be canceled if they have not already finished.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: From url, provided from the location header in the Run Multiple Calculations endpoint.

schema.description: From url, provided from the location header in the Run Multiple Calculations endpoint.

204.description: Expected response, request was cancelled successfully.

schema.description: FactSet's request key header.

get.summary: Convert PA dates to absolute format
get.description: This endpoint converts the given start and end dates in FactSet date format to yyyymmdd format for a PA calculation. For more information on FactSet date format, please refer to the PA Engine API documentation under the 'API Documentation' section in the developer portal.

Account

accounts.description: List of account and composite files.

id.description: User's FactSet account path OR benchmark.

holdingsmode.description: Holdings Mode can be B&H, TBR or OMS.

PADateParameters.description: The date parameters for PA calculation.

componentid.description: The PA Engine component identifier to analyze.

groups.description: List of groupings for the PA calculation. This will take precedence over the groupings saved in the PA document.

columns.description: List of columns for the PA calculation. This will take precedence over the columns saved in the PA document.

componentdetail.description: Component detail type for the PA component. It can be GROUPS or TOTALS.

id.description: User's FactSet account OR benchmark id.

SPARIdentifier.description: The account/benchmark parameter for SPAR calculation.

SPARDateParameters.description: The date parameters for SPAR calculation.

componentid.description: The SPAR Engine component identifier to analyze.

accounts.description: List of accounts for SPAR calculation.

id.description: User's FactSet account path OR benchmark.

VaultIdentifier.description: The account/benchmark parameter for Vault calculation.

VaultDateParameters.description: The date parameters for Vault calculation

componentid.description: The Vault component identifier to analyze.

componentdetail.description: Component detail type for the Vault component. It can be GROUPS or TOTALS.

id.description: User's FactSet account path OR benchmark.

holdingsmode.description: Holdings Mode can be B&H, TBR or OMS.

enddate.description: Calculation's end date or as of date.

PubDateParameters.description: The date parameters for Publisher calculation.

document.description: The Publisher Engine document to analyze.

units.description: Number of calculation units in batch.

error.description: The error in a calculation unit.

result.description: The result URL of the calculation.

units.description: Number of calculation units in batch.

pa.description: List of statuses for PA calculation units.

spar.description: List of statuses for SPAR calculation units.

vault.description: List of statuses for Vault calculation units.

pub.description: List of statuses for Publisher calculation units.

id.description: User's FactSet account path OR a benchmark id.

name.description: User's FactSet account path OR a benchmark name.

id.description: User's FactSet account path OR a benchmark id to compare against.

name.description: User's FactSet account path OR a benchmark name to compare against.

accounts.description: List of accounts saved in the PA document.

benchmarks.description: List of benchmarks saved in the PA document.

snapshot.description: Is the component type snapshot or subperiod.
